messages.content: A Z boson is a fundamental particle, or gauge boson, that mediates the weak nuclear force in the Standard Model of particle physics. Its discovery in 1984 confirmed the existence of the electroweak theory, which explained how the electromagnetic and weak nuclear forces interact with matter.
What is the Z boson in 1 paragraph?

The Z boson is a fundamental particle that is a gauge boson that mediates the weak nuclear force in the Standard Model of particle physics. It was discovered in 1984 and is essential to our understanding of the behavior of subatomic particles.
